newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX cuts margins on crude, gasoline, heating oil.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX cuts margins on crude, gasoline, heating oil.

text.p: The New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) said it lowered margins on its crude oil, gasoline and heating oil futures contracts at the close of business Friday.
Margins for all three were cut to $1,500 for clearing members; to $1,650 for members; and to $2,025 for customers.

Perviously, crude oil margins were $2,200 for clearing members, $2,420 for members, and $2,970 for customers. Heating oil and gasoline margins were $2,000 for clearing members, $2,200 for members and $2,700 for customers.
